title: Smith & Wesson lifts full-year guidance posts Q1 beat
text:
(MENAFN - ProactiveInvestors) Smith & Wesson Holding ( NASDAQ:SWHC ) jumped in Friday trading after the firearms maker lifted its revenue and profit guidance for the fiscal year while reporting better-than-expected results for the past quarter. Shares rose 11.2% to 18.03 at 2:10 p.m. in New York expanding this yearâ€™s gain to 90%.
For the year ending April 30 the Springfield Massachusetts-based company expects earnings excluding items of 1.14 to 1.19 a share and sales of 610 million to 620 million according to a statement released on Thursday. 
Previously it projected adjusted per-earnings of 1.02 to 1.07 on net sales of 605 million to 615 million.
For the three months ended July 31 net income was 14.4mln or 0.26 per share compared to 14.56mln or 0.26 per share 
Non-GAAP EPS was 0.32 per share topping the analyst expectation of 0.23 per share according to Capital IQ.
Revenue gained 12.1% year-over-year to 147.8mln also topping the Wall Street consensus of 142.9mln.
The firearms division had strong orders for products including its M&P 15 Sport rifles and Thompson/Center Venture rifles while the accessories unit posted strong results.
